availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel H. Hughes (Union County, Kentucky, attorney and notary public.)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, attorney and notary public. Washington County, Kentucky native. Son of John Reed Hughes and Martha Nantz Hughes. Married to Wright Parker Hughes in Union County, Kentucky, on December 18, 1855. Father of Bettie Hughes, Mattie Hughes, Henry Hughes, and George P. Hughes. Graduated from Central College at Boyle County, Kentucky, on June 26, 1852. Resident of Washington County in 1850. Household owned nineteen enslaved persons in Washington County in 1850. Attorney Union County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Union County in 1860. Notary public in Union County.

ab.bibl:
